column4: hi people  i have been using Debian Sarge for the past one year and i am really impressed with it but today i got 10 sets of Ubuntu X86 CDS i am just thinking of installing it
i just want to know whether Ubuntu would be better than Debian Sarge
infact i have been a KDE user but for the past few days i ve switched to Gnome . is Ubuntu better than Debian Sarge?
its a question of taste and purpose...
i like Debian and Ubuntu is based on Debian and i am a developer i use my system for Development so in that case what do you say?
so what do you say . I ve got Ubuntu 5.0.4 CDS so tell me what would it be like ? :-)
i am running Gnome 2.8 but Ubuntu has got 2.10 and thats a major advantage
how about the number of repositories for apt-get
but if i install it will it be fast enough like Sarge?
you got some space on your harddisk?
no extra space either i ve to remove Sarge and then try Ubuntu
does Ubuntu have alsa support in it ?
but i am just worried about one thing the speed Sarge runs is good will Ubuntu run at the same speed ?
but i dont have that much space
will you kill me if its slower?
